Coshocton County Dept. of Job & Family Services Contact Info.

div.h2: To Our Seniors, Their Families and Our Ridgewood Community
div.h3: Update, Wednesday April 24 at 8:30 a.m. from Superintendent Mike Masloski

span.div: Seniors and Senior Parents/Guardians: Please have your student check their Ridgewood email for amessage from Mrs. Ionno. We want to recognize each of our seniors on social media to pay tribute to this amazing group of kids. Please have your student send Mrs. Ionno an email with their high school activities, plans for after graduation, and favorite memory of Ridgewood High School. We will begin recognizing afew seniors each day until the end of the school year. If you have any questions, you can email myself or Mrs. Ionno or call the high school. We will also keep you posted as we finalize plans for upcoming special events.

Students and Community:On behalf of Ridgewood Local School Board and our staff we all feel terrible but understand the decision by Governor Dewine to close school for the rest of the year and to continue remote learning. We are especially hurting for the Class of 2020. Senior class students and families need to know it is ok and validated to feel cheated out of the last few month of the school year. Our staff will be working diligently to create alternative opportunities for our senior class for milestones such as Senior Awards, Graduation and Prom. Our thoughts and prayers are with all our students, families and community during this trying time. Remember we are astrong resilient community that will overcome these obstacles. We have done it in the past and will continue to grow and get better as aschool district and community. If you need to talk to someone or have questions, please reach out to any staff members as well as myself at 740-545-7639. Thank you

div.h2: Latest Information on the CoronaVirus and District Updates

div.br:
We will continue to serve student meals for the remainder of the school year, May 21, 2020. We will have bus delivery on Tuesdays using the p.m. bus routes and curbside service on Tuesday and Thursdays from 11:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. at Ridgewood Middle School.
Students do NOT have to be present to receive student meals. The Federal government waived that requirement. We ask that someone to be at your stop at the p.m. drop off time to receive astudent meal. Please do not enter the bus. You need to remain at the designated place of safety. Please be flexible within 10 minutes of the stop times. Those using RMS curbside service need to remain in the vehicle to receive the meal. If you are able, please pop your trunk and we will place it in there. If not we will place it in the passenger front seat. Please do not have anyone in that seat. Again these meals are free and students will receive abreakfast and lunch at the same time. We can serve any child from birth to 18 years of age from any district. We are willing to serve children meals that are at babysitters or daycares. If you are not along abus route and unable to make it to Ridgewood Middle School, please contact Michelle Stoffer at [emailprotected]us or 740-545-5301 for delivery service. If your child has any dietary needs, please contact Michelle Stoffer.
Weekly Lessons/Grading/All Calls
Enrichment and Intervention Week for April 27. Students will not receive any additional assignments for the week of April 27. We are asking students to use this week to complete your blizzard bags and weekly lessons from April 13 and 20. Your classroom teachers will be contacting you this week by zoom meetings, email, messenger, or phone.
We will be using letter grades at RMS and RHS for the fourth nine week grading period. We are giving full credit for best effort completion of the blizzard bags and weekly lessons. We understand there are factors outside our control with learning being moved to an online or non-online format. We are asking parents/guardians whose child is completing non-online assignment to notify their childs teacher or school building by email or phone once they have completed to the best of their ability the blizzard bags and/or weekly lessons. We also understand there might be barriers for some on the online lessons, if so please contact your childs teacher or school building. We will not be collecting any paper copies of student work at this time. Please keep these materials in asafe place. Please use one of the options below to indicate once your child has completed their blizzard bag and/or weekly lesson.
1) Email the following information to your childs first period teacher: childs name, childs grade, parent/guardian name and statement indicating my child has completed the weekly lesson for April 13 and 20 to their best ability.
2) Call your childs school building and leave a message with the following information or email the following information: childs name, childs grade, parent/guardian name and statement indicating my child has completed the weekly lesson for the week of April 13 and 20 to their best ability.
All Call system allows our teachers to communicate with their students about their lessons and other information. RES teachers will use the all call system at least once during this week. RMS and RHS teachers will be using the following schedule:
Monday: Language Arts 4:00 p.m.
Tuesday: Math4:00 p.m.
Wednesday: Social Studies 4:00 p.m.
Thursday: Science 4:00 p.m.

br.br:
We are restricting visitors to all buildings at this time. If you need anything, please call your childs school building or central office. If no one answers, please leave avoicemail.
Ridgewood Elementary School 740-545-5312
Ridgewood Middle School 740-545-6335
Ridgewood High School 740-545-6345

br.strong: Everything is subject to change. We will reassess the calendar of events on May 1.

div.a: View Additional Social Media Posts & All RLSD App Updates

span.p: We are pleased and excited to announce Ridgewood OneView - an on-line forms program allowing parents/guardians to maintain required forms on-line. From this page you can access the Parent Portal. Your first step is toset-up your OneView parent account. Please note that in order to set-up an account you must have a vaild e-mail address. If you have a valid e-mail account click on the Parent Portal icon below.

span.div: If you do not have an e-mail, you can click here to create one.

div.a: Instructions for Back to School Forms

div.span: Parent mentors provide information and support to families of children with disabilities and their school districts. Click Here for details on the mentoring program and contact information.

Homeless students are eligable for certain rights and protections under the federal McKinney-Vento Act. Homless students have the right to enroll in school immediately -even if lacking documents normally required. Homeless students can enroll in the local school or continue attending their school of origin (the school they attended when permanently housed or the school in which they were last enrolled). Homeless students can recieve transportaion to and from the school of origin, if requested. Mike Masloski is the liason for the homeless at Ridgewood Local Schools He can be contacted at 740-545-6354 or 330-340-8660. For addition information on federal rights for homeless school-age youth and eligibility requirements Click Here.

span.strong: District Champs for the first time in school history! Record: 24-2

div.span: Congratulations to Our Own Grace Gottwalt!

span.div: Grace, aSenior gymnast here at Ridgewood, placed 6th in the District Meet. Competition was fierce with 39 schools participating in the Central District. Grace also received All District Team honors and All Ohio Academics honors. She will now advance to the State competition. Graces dedication to gymnastics is apparent. With no one else at Ridgewood interested in gymnatics, a team could not be formed. Grace then started working out with the Tri-Valley gymnastic team,but she continues to compete for Ridgewood. Congratulations Grace! We couldnt be prouder!

br.span: We are pround of our student members of the Coshocton Youth Leadership program. Their assignment was to Pay forward a monetary donation. For additional information and photo's click theRead More button.

div.span: Ridgewood Opposes Ed Choice Scholarship (Voucher) Program

span.div: RidgewoodSuperintendant Mike Masloski speaks out about the Ohio Government Ed Choice Scholarship (Voucher) Program:

Our School Board on Monday, February 10th, passed aresolution opposing the state of Ohio EdCHOICE Scholarship (Voucher) Program. This voucher program takes school tax money to pay for private school education. I (Mike Masloski) plan on providing written and verbal testimony for the committee conference of the General Assembly. I (Masloski) had the opportunity to voice our displeasure of this voucher program at apress conference at MVESC. This voucher program currently affects Ridgewood Elementary School. In the press conference, Itell the story of RES.
Click Here to see the press conference.Scroll to the bottom of the WHIZ page to hear the entire 11 minute press conference.

strong.span: Congratulations to our Ridgewood Elementarystudents and staff for earning the prestigious 2018-2019

i.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small

div.span: Our Own Kate Shivers Receives CORAS Award!

span.div: Kate Shivers, head cook at the Elementary, has been awarded the 2020 Coalition of Rural and Appalacian Schools Support Staff Award for her dedication to the students, staff and community of the Ridgewood Local School District. Kate has been a Ridgewood District employee for 30 years.
The Award was presented at the CORAS Winter Meeting held at the Ohio University, Zanesville Branch on January 15, 2020. Congatulations Kate! We couldn't be prouder!

div.span: Former Ridgewood Student-Athlete Leads NKU to the Horizon League Tournament Championship Title

span.div: Laura Crawford, a graduate of Ridgewood attending Northern Kentucky, led NKU to the Horizon League Tournament Championship Title which earned them a bid in the Division 1 NCAA tournament against Michigan. Laura was named MVP of the Horizon League Tournament game. We are very proud of her and her team's accomplishments!

div.span: Our Elementary Teachers Present at the OCalicon 2019 Conference!

span.div: Our elementary teachers were honored by being asked to present at the OCalicon 2019 Conference held in Columbus, Ohio November 20 22. This years conference featured Inclusive Education. Ms. Carolyn Wilson, Ms. Heather Kinsey, Ms. Brandalyn Regula and Ms. Jamie Davis presented An Inclusive Team Approach: Utilizing Targeted Interventions for Student Success. The presentation demonstrated how our district utilizes apre-school approach to assess all areas of childhood development. The presentation focused on acase study to demonstrate how the needs of the whole child are addressed. Using the Underlying Characteristic Checklist and the Comprehensive Autism Planning System, we create strategies that allow children to be successful.

div.span: Information of Vaping from the Center for Disease Control

br.span: In an effort to keep our Parents, Guardians and Students informed on vaping, we would like to share this CDC website:Know the Risks: A Guide to E-cigarettes.The website contains a PowerPoint presentaion and a PDF of information. Click Here to view the website.
